titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stephen Sandy Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:58

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Stephen Sandy Papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, personal papers, printed material, photographs, and audiovisual material created and accumulated by American poet Stephen Sandy. The papers document the creation, publication, and reception of Sandy's work from his earliest pamphlet, Mary Baldwin (1962), to more recent work, shedding light on Sandy's poetic sensibility and his personal and professional relationships with other poets. Significant quantities of material relate to his work at Bennington College.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase, on various funds, from Stephen Sandy (Yale 1955), 2001-2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 29-30, 45 (audio and video recordings): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 49, 50 (computer disks): Restricted Fragile Material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Stephen Sandy Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stephen Sandy Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, in 2013. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Uncat MSS 99, Uncat MSS 506, Uncat MSS 875, Uncat MSS 902, Uncat MSS 903, Uncat MSS 967, Uncat MSS 1028, Uncat MSS 1200, and Uncat Za File 563.

bioghist.head: Stephen Sandy (1934-)
bioghist.p: Stephen Sandy is an American poet. Born in 1934, he received a B.A. in English from Yale in 1955 and a Ph.D. in English from Harvard in 1963. He has taught at Boston University, Brown University, and Bennington College. His works include: Netsuke Days (2008), Weathers Permitting (2005), Surface Impressions: A Poem in Eight Parts (2002), Black Box (1999), and The Thread: New and Selected Poems (1998). Sandy is the poet featured in the documentary The Biologist, the Poet and the Funeral Director (2007), directed by Harvey Edwards.
More information about Stephen Sandy can be found on his web site.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Stephen Sandy Papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, personal papers, printed material, photographs, and audiovisual material created and accumulated by American poet Stephen Sandy. The papers document the creation, publication, and reception of Sandy's work from his earliest pamphlet, Mary Baldwin (1962), to more recent work, shedding light on Sandy's poetic sensibility and his personal and professional relationships with other poets. Significant quantities of material relate to his work at Bennington College.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into sixteen groupings: I. January 2001 Acquisition. II. February 2002 Acquisition. III. May 2002 Acquisition. IV. July 2003 Acquisition. V. February 2006 Acquisition. VI. April 2006 Acquisition. VII. July 2006 Acquisition. VIII. August 2006 Acquisition. IX. October 2006 Acquisition. X. May 2008 Acquisition. XI. June 2008 Acquisition. XII. June 2009 Acquisition. XIII. June 2011 Acquisition. XIV. December 2011 Acquisition. XV. February 2012 Acquisition. XVI. July 2012 Acquisition.
Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time.

Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with and/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section. Material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The January 2001 Acquisition consists of material removed from books acquired from Stephen Sandy. Material consists of correspondence, notes, and writings of Stephen Sandy, including the poem "Hogback Lookout," draft, typescript, annotated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under two headings: Correspondence and Notes, and Writings.

arrangement.p: Organized under three headings: Correspondence and Subject Files, Writings, and Other Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The July 2003 Acquisition consists of correspondence, writings, printed material, and other papers. The Correspondence and Subject Files consist chiefly of professional and personal letters from writers, documenting the literary community in which Sandy is active, and related papers. Other subject files consist of material relating to a particular person or topic (e.g. W. H. Auden). Writings include drafts (autograph manuscript and typescript), proofs, and printed versions, some corrected.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The July 2003 Acquisition consists of correspondence, writings, printed material, and other papers. The Correspondence and Subject Files consist chiefly of professional and personal letters from writers and literary organizations, documenting the literary community in which Sandy is active, and related papers. Other subject files consist of material relating to a particular person or topic (e.g. Ali Agha Shahid). Writings include drafts (autograph manuscript and typescript), proofs, and printed versions, some corrected. Other Papers include printed material and ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under three headings: Journals, Correspondence, and Other Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The June 2008 Acquisition consists of the journals of Stephen Sandy, correspondence, and photographs. Journals include personal reflections, notes toward drafts of writings, poems in various draft versions, and financial notes. Correspondence consists chiefly of professional and personal letters from writers and literary organizations, documenting the literary community in which Sandy is active. Other subject files consist of material relating to a particular person or topic (e.g. Calvin Coolidge Memorial Foundation). Other Papers include photographs of Stephen Sandy at Bennington College and with his daughter.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged numerically. Numbers were assigned prior to acquisition by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under five headings: Correspondence and Subject Files, Journals, Photographs and Other Papers, Bennington College Material, and Posters and Broadsides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The June 2009 Acquisition consists of the journals of Stephen Sandy, correspondence, printed material including posters and broadsides, and photographs. Journals include both personal reflections and notes toward drafts of writings. Correspondence consists chiefly of professional and personal letters from writers and literary organizations, documenting the literary community in which Sandy is active. Other subject files consist of material relating to a particular person or topic (e.g. Relinquishment, Bennington College Retirement). Other Papers include personal photographs of Stephen Sandy, friends, family members, and colleagues, and personal papers including diplomas.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged roughly chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description and numbering of journals based on information supplied with the collection. No descriptions were provided for B37 and B38.

did.unittitle: B4. "IV." Yaddo. Austin Warren dialogs. Fiction notes ("Good Time War"). Virgil Thompson, etc.
B5. Harvard. Grays Hall. AW death.
B8. Providence. Brown strike / protests. Draft poems. Inventories. Teaching.
B12. Cambridge '68 - Bennington '69 - '71. Miscellany. Arts & Crafts project.
B14. Bennington (Shingle Cottage), Japan (Tokyo: Tom Hall res., Totsuka). Early drafts poems in Roofs (Japan)
B15. Japan. Tokyo. Drafts / notes for poems.
B16. Bennington; White Creek. Drafts of poems.
B18. California; "Sebastopol Log". 1). Cross-country bus (via mpls). 2). House sit for Bro. AFS. 3) sights in California
B19. White Creek, Eagle Bridge NY. More Calif, house sit AFS Sebastopol. Long Beach, visit Aunt Irene, notes of her talk.
B20. Bennington Coll. notes & quotes, mostly A. Feinman, as to Camille & Harold Bloom (+ Camille Paglia lecture)
B21. Bennington College. Orchard C. (Melissa Greene on Nick Delbanco Stephen Dunn on Ashbery, etc.) Drafts of poems, e.g., "Pen Doom."
B24. "Bennington College." Student, Healey, o.d. death. Andre Bernold & J. Barr (Chmn Board).
B26. Davidson College and Dreams, NC.
B27. Clare's graduation. Frank Bidart, Mark Edmundson, etc.

B28. Bennington Coll. Clare; Nat. Clare at Brown, take & fetch. Orig/early drafts "Mother's Day" (Atlantic), other poems ("productive" yr). Family & college. Annisquam, Moviuses. Student Matt Gross shot in massacre atop Empire State.

B29. College. Yaddo. Drafts poems for Black Box. "Pastel Evidence; "Wednesday," "Detention Period," "Home Movie" etc.Full orig text Diva. College, R Hadas for reading. Arthur Danto @ Benn. Good yr for poem sketches

B30. Bennington / Weathers Permitting work. Imp. quotes. Bishop; Eliz Sifton. Clare to Wash. DC. Pooh Randall. Bush epigrams; War. Andre Gide journals. Read & taught New Engl Coll, ‚ÄîdeNiord's program; (meet Li Young Lee) on way to see Burriss Young, pancreatic c. in Cambridge; Dwight Miller phones says that BY died (while I taught.)

B30 ¬Ω. Bennington College. TNSC = Tuesday Nite Supper Club, faculty to whom SS read. SS resigns from Benn faculty. Family together, porch at 25 West St. Summer MFA (Liam bin Rector); readings, Skidmore. Brimfield. S (sister Susan) nervous; boys there.

B31. "This Day and Age." Yaddo, Aug, 03, Term to come. Ned Rorem. Felstiners, briefly. NYC Sept: Eakins show; Mike & Evie Malinowitz, Star Black, Ashbery, Klitzman. Lunch Humanities Club/Group NYU w/ R Howard. Herb Leibowitz, Ann Hollander, S. Rushdie, chatted abt his staying Dorset near me, Liz Frank, Ted Mooney, Susan Sontag, Liz Frank. Sat w/ Ashbery & chatted on train back, Hudson. A reading Pevear's Dostoevsky Idiot. Ruefle's Musk Ox People.
B31 ¬Ω. National Book Awards ceremony, NYU. Yale PBK Poet New Haven trip. Tom Foster. Radiation.
B32. Bennington. NYC, July. Delanty. T Foster. Brimfield: Flea, J&S, John Portola their friend. Visit Peter Davison. 72 River St Bos. Shrunken. Chemo. Carriage Loft. S. Kunitz. Poetry.
B33. Gloucester. NYC. Bennington. Clare & Peter, Chris Miller, Ted Hoagland, Joan Gardner for Thksgiving din. Death Tom Foster
B34. Reading @ Northshire, no publ. Weathers Permitting publisht. "11.iv.05". Note draft to Annabel Davis-Goff, read Fox's Walk.Scan. Dr. StClair. Retirement aftermath

B35. Bennington. C Dewey with Tibet stands, one made on lathe; he inquired of Renate Wheelock, Explain tumor not "in" but "at" pancreas; & her surgeries & chemo's. (Seen by Ruth Dewey and Peggy at Alldays w Joan Gardner). This little world journal. Down days. Trip to Burlington

B36. Clare's wedding. McCullough garden. Dick Wilbur, Bruce Weber. (This the Wilbur talk on Frost reading at Tishman, Col. for the Frost Stone House Museum Sun 13 Nov.) Accidie. Remarks, dialog Mother Anita.
Bennington College Trustees Entertaining themselves and Barr as Barr Resigns, A musical, partial script
"Hate mail" concerning President Coleman firing faculty at Bennington College

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, petitions, letters, newspaper clippings concerning Coleman's firing of faculty in 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning Bennington's re-organization, 1994-2006, chiefly New York Times and Bennington Banner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, documents, legal pronouncements, concerning the decision by Bennington College to fire Ted Hoagland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "File No. Two": correspondence, including letters to and from students concerning the Booth House Party and vandalism (resignation of Jonathan Sherman from Judicial Committee); college documents concerning restructuring; clippings concerning new firings; material concerning Sexual Harassment "classes"; spat in Bennington Banner between Jamaica Kincaid and Mary Oliver; Trustees play, lyrics (parodying & using Gilbert & Sullivan) on the occasion of retirement from board by Barr

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, "galleys" (freely distributed opinion sheets) to and from Trustees, concerning 1994 Firings; "Steering Committee"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rock The House. Bennington: Dewey House, Bennington College, 1993. Xerox collection of photographs. Cross-dress party at Bennington. Includes "Sex & Drugs" survey. Letter from Tom Gross. Elder man dancing is Chi-chung Huang, "C.C." Final page shows graffiti: "Liz Why Are You Killing Our School?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Camping and climbing trip to Washington, Mts. Baker & Shuksan, with David Lein

(All these texts are from Roofs, Houghton Mifflin, 1971).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 45 (audio recordings): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The June 2011 Acquisition consists of printed musical scores featuring text by Stephen Sandy, writings, and correspondence. Writings consist chiefly of drafts and fair copies of individual poems, accompanied by notes that document each poem's publication history. Also included are proofs of book-length publications accompanied by correspondence with editors. Correspondence consists of a single autograph letter, signed, from Arturo Vivante to Stephen Sandy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The July 2012 Acquisition consists of writings, ephemera, and printed material. Writings consists of drafts (autograph manuscript, typescript, and printouts) and proofs of individual poems and other writings. Other papers include additional writings of Stephen Sandy (chiefly juvenilia), printed material, and ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Chiefly arranged alphabetically. Unsorted material is filed at the end of the list.
